channel.title: GUI progrem
channel.description:
Whats the best program for creating Java GUI's? The only one I have used so far is IntelliJ GUI designer, but I simply hate the slow scrolling on that program.
What was the first and original GUI designer program? Was it good?
Tutorial on setting up the GUI so it works?

item.title: GUI progrem
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“Sleep, post:21, topic:71443”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=104982.msg1055731#msg1055731 date=1174970006]
I much prefer writing GUIs myself, the old fashioned way. But the best program I have found to do it for me is Netbeans, it’s excellent in my opinion.

http://www.netbeans.org/
[/quote]
NetBeans ftw ^^[/quote]

I just used it and it owns any other IDE with GUI creating.

Read full topic

item.title: GUI progrem
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:18, topic:71443”][quote author=ownagesbot link=topic=104982.msg1058075#msg1058075 date=1175043778]
Not owned at all, infact he’s just posted a totally useless snippet of code. Depreciated != removed from API. Get your facts straight.
[/quote]

I’ve posted a totally useless snippet of Suns code, which they have to support and which makes show() and hide() more efficient until they update their API for a reason that isn’t as superfluous as “better method naming”.[/quote]

It looks like you are proposing that they remove it. It’s very obvious why they haven’t, so I assume you aren’t proposing this and I just missed something.

Read full topic

item.title: GUI progrem
item.dc:creator: @k00dr k00dr
item.description:
@k00dr wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:8, topic:71443”][quote author=k00dr link=topic=104982.msg1055689#msg1055689 date=1174969055]
Shame on you, show has been long deprecated
[/quote]

[quote author=java.awt.Component]
public void setVisible(boolean b) {
show(b);
}

public void show(boolean b) {
    if (b) {
        show();
    } else {
        hide();
    }
}[/quote][/quote]

Owned …but it’s still deprecated!

Read full topic

item.title: GUI progrem
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

[quote=“uber killer, post:12, topic:71443”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=104982.msg1055815#msg1055815 date=1174972340]

Rofl i never thought there would be Any programs to make them iv been making mine myself

:eek:

I never knew there was a way to create a GUI through Java code.

Alright, where’s the tutorial?
[/quote]Go back to Visual Gay.

^ My statement holds validity because most people do not see the GUI code for their MS Visual projects (Unless you’re sexy)

I do not understand visual, how could I go back to it?
This is how all this GUI thing started…
I installed jetbrains intelliJ, and I found out you could make a GUI through the GUI designer. I also saw that you could create a GUI in SCAR scripts too. I thought you had to use a designer to create the GUI, but I do not know how to do the other way, I never knew you could create your own GUI without using a designer.[/quote]

You can create a UI in any language that isn’t a peice of shit

Read full topic

item.title: GUI progrem
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:4, topic:71443”]Well, start with this

import java.awt.Frame; class GUIProgram { public static void main(String[] wtf){ Frame frame = new Frame("A frame"); frame.setSize(300, 300); frame.show(); } }[/quote]

Alright, how to add buttons/labels/radiobuttons/etc to the Jpanel/Frame?
